<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/britain-officially-leaves-eu?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Everyone in the U.K. Tonight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SpongeBob's " Ight Imma Head Out" meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNDE3OTA1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SpongeBob</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On June 23, 2016, 52% of British voters chose to leave the EU, a sprawling governmental organization spanning 28 countries.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A lot has happened in the 1,317 days following the vote:</strong> Prime ministers stepped down, proposed deals came and went, ceremonial maces <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/dec/10/day-of-brexit-drama-ends-with-mp-grabbing-the-ceremonial-mace?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were grabbed</a>. But tonight, at 11pm London time (6pm ET), Brexit is actually, seriously, indubitably happening. The U.K. will leave the bloc and the EU will become a perfect cube.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's a historic moment that reflects the dissatisfaction many Europeans feel toward the ambitious political and economic experiment. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What lies ahead</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We've all done it:</strong> the awkward double goodbye. Britain will enter a transition period in which...not much changes. The U.K. will remain part of the EU's tariff-free single market and customs union. <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/16/travel/brexit-travel-impact.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Travel</a> shouldn't be affected. The U.K. will <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-51194363?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still contribute</a> to the EU budget. And Liverpudlians will be free to go work in Milan and vice versa. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">During this period, U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson will be zipping around the globe trying to score trade deals with the EU and other countries. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It'll be a sprint. The transition ends at the end of 2020, and Johnson has ruled out any extension.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The EU's recent trade deals with Japan and Canada took seven years to massage, </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/brexit-scotland-trade-eu.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the NYT notes</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>"The U.K. is entering a decade of potentially profound structural change," Bank of England Governor Mark Carney <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-boe/sensing-a-pick-up-boe-keeps-rates-steady-as-carney-bows-out-idUSKBN1ZT1FN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> at his final policy meeting yesterday. Even if Johnson gets those trade deals signed, lower immigration and business investment will stunt already limp economic growth. If he doesn't…expect supply chain chaos.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The "not very important, but still fun" section</h2>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>British passports will </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-42443253?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">switch</a></span><span> from the EU's burgundy back to blue, a design that was introduced nearly 100 years ago. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Today, the Royal Mint will </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-51250753?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">release</a></span><span> about 3 million commemorative 50p Brexit coins bearing the inscription "Peace, prosperity and friendship with all nations." </span>
</li>
</ol>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/ibms-ginni-rometty-says-bye-big-blue?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ginni Rometty Is Sailing Into the Big Blue
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="IBM CEO Ginni Rometty " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNDI1MTcxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sean Gallup/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">IBM made the surprise <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/30/ibm-ceo-ginni-rometty-steps-down-arvind-krishna-to-take-over.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announcement</a> yesterday that CEO Ginni Rometty will step aside April 6. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking back </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Rometty <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2011/10/26/technology/ibm-names-a-new-chief.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ascended</a> to the corner office in Jan. 2012, IBM was still shedding its image as a legacy hardware provider. Rometty refocused the company on cloud computing services and emerging technologies like AI, blockchain, and quantum computing. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s been a bumpy ride for investors, who watched IBM stock decline 27% over the last eight years.  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>IBM has struggled to keep pace in the competitive cloud market as Amazon and Microsoft surged ahead.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Don’t forget the trailblazing.</strong> Rometty was IBM’s first female CEO and one of just a handful of female Fortune 500 CEOs.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Taking over from Rometty is cloud and cognitive software boss Arvind Krishna, a key architect of IBM’s 2019 acquisition of Red Hat—a $34 billion play for what's known as the "hybrid cloud" market. Red Hat’s CEO Jim Whitehurst will become IBM's president. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">IBM stock was up as much as 5% after hours following the news.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECOMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/amazon-ridiculous-holiday-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon's Ridiculous Holiday Quarter: By the Numbers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Amazon Prime Air Plane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNDIzODE4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amazon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$87.4 billion: </strong>Revenue that beat estimates. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$3.3 billion</strong>: Net income that beat estimates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">798,000: </strong>Amazon’s <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-results/amazon-holiday-sales-jump-as-one-day-shipping-quadruples-stock-up-13-idUSKBN1ZT2XU?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">global headcount</a> after it added over 250,000 part and full-time employees over the holiday season. That's more than the population of Vermont. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">150+ million: </strong>The number of Prime subscribers, up from 100 million in April 2018.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Four: </strong>After Amazon’s 11% stock surge in after-hours trading, it will eclipse $1 trillion in market cap today. There will be four public U.S. companies worth at least $1 trillion (the others are Apple, Alphabet, and Microsoft). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$93 billion: </strong>The market cap of UPS at the close yesterday. We only mention it because Amazon’s market cap rose more than $110 billion after it reported earnings. So it <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/amazon-s-post-market-rally-adds-the-equivalent-of-ups-in-value?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained a UPS</a> plus lots of Morning Brews. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Amazon’s heavy investments in shipping paid off during the holidays.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/coronavirus-hits-unexpected-corners-biz-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Hits Market for Antique Rococo Birdhouses
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well...not yet. But the viral outbreak has hurt some unexpected corners of the biz world. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">First, the obvious:</strong> China’s economic indicators. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The effects of the coronavirus could </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-economy-morgan-stanley/morgan-stanley-warns-coronavirus-could-drag-on-global-chinese-gdp-growth-idUSKBN1ZS27P?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">knock</a></span><span> up to one percentage point off Chinese economic growth in Q1, Morgan Stanley said. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Global growth will likely see a slight dip, but nothing permanent. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Next,</strong> the “hadn’t thought of it, but makes sense I guess.”  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Esports leagues have </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/coronavirus-hits-esports-leagues-forcing-them-to-cancel-matches?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nixed</a></span><span> several matches in China planned for February and March. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And then,</strong> the “sacré bleu.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some upscale Parisian shops </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-france-economy/paris-shops-feel-the-pinch-as-virus-keeps-chinese-tourists-away-idUSKBN1ZT2OR?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have seen</a></span><span> a drop in visitors. Chinese shoppers are usually among their most generous patrons, spending an average of $1,136 when in the City of Light, per the city’s tourism board. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Finally,</strong> the “...what?” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/7d370c6197d3d9cbac643ae5a20c62e8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">implied</a></span><span> yesterday the virus outbreak might encourage American manufacturers to move operations from China back to the States. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Yesterday, the World Health Organization declared the coronavirus outbreak a global public health emergency.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Henry Is a HENRY
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.fool.com/ecap/stock-advisor/sa-5-stocks-under-50-a/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210035&psource=esamnbwdg0210035&wsource=esamnbwdg0210035&testId=e-sa-5-stocks-under-50&cellId=0&campaign=sa-5-free-stocks-under-50" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Motley Fool " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=409 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580131801.gif">

<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Motley Fool " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580131801.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Henry, our copywriter, is many things. He’s a bicycle helmet enthusiast (he falls a lot), a connoisseur of second lunch, and someone who has a body built by mini golf. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Henry is also a HENRY. That stands for “High Earner, Not Rich Yet.” It means that despite earning good money, he’s still not quite there yet when it comes to amassing a nest egg for the future. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So he’s turning to the stock experts at <a href="https://www.fool.com/ecap/stock-advisor/sa-5-stocks-under-50-a/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210035&psource=esamnbwdg0210035&wsource=esamnbwdg0210035&testId=e-sa-5-stocks-under-50&cellId=0&campaign=sa-5-free-stocks-under-50" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a> to help him jumpstart his financial future. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/ecap/stock-advisor/sa-5-stocks-under-50-a/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210035&psource=esamnbwdg0210035&wsource=esamnbwdg0210035&testId=e-sa-5-stocks-under-50&cellId=0&campaign=sa-5-free-stocks-under-50" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a> has been providing financial advice to HENRYs like Henry since 1993. As soon as he finishes his 3pm BLT, he assures me he’s signing up for their <a href="https://www.fool.com/ecap/stock-advisor/sa-5-stocks-under-50-a/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210035&psource=esamnbwdg0210035&wsource=esamnbwdg0210035&testId=e-sa-5-stocks-under-50&cellId=0&campaign=sa-5-free-stocks-under-50" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5 Stock Picks For Under $49</a>. And since, like we said, Henry ain’t a millionaire yet, he can download the list for free for a limited time. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Be like Henry and put your HENRY days behind you.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/ecap/stock-advisor/sa-5-stocks-under-50-a/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210035&psource=esamnbwdg0210035&wsource=esamnbwdg0210035&testId=e-sa-5-stocks-under-50&cellId=0&campaign=sa-5-free-stocks-under-50" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get the 5 Stocks Picks for Under $49 list for free</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-CIGARETTE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/altria-writes-juul-investmentagain?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Altria Bought a Junk Juul
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A broken Juul " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580419501.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A broken Juul " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580419501.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Beware the pawn shop. Yesterday, tobacco giant Altria said the value of its stake in Juul had <a href="https://apnews.com/3eea9f387caa0683cc01212e51878cde?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plummeted</a> by $4.1 billion. The e-cigarette leader’s value is down 67% since December 2018, when Altria paid $12.8 billion for 35%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Altria CEO Howard Willard attributed the writedown—the second since October—to three factors: </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Litigation. Lawsuits against Juul </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/altria-juul-investment-7f9f5b5a-d116-4b1b-8897-d48d80b8c625.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have increased</a></span><span> more than 80% since November 2019, Altria says. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A mysterious, vaping-related lung illness. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Increasingly strict </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/09/25/764201798/juul-will-agree-to-ban-on-flavored-vaping-products-says-its-ceo-is-stepping-down?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">regulations</a></span><span> on flavored vaping products popular with the youths. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">To cope, Altria's setting boundaries. </strong>It <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/altria-takes-4-1-billion-writedown-on-juul-investment-11580386578?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retracted</a> an original agreement to support Juul's marketing and distribution, and reworked Juul's board to include Altria representatives. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, Altria secured the right to dump its non-compete if either a) Juul is blocked from selling vaping products for at least a year or b) the value of Altria's stake in Juul dwindles to 10% of the original price ($1.28 billion). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>to stay on U.S. shelves, Juul needs to submit its products for FDA approval by May.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/brews-weekly-news-quiz-january-31?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

</font></a>
</h1>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">'O valley of plenty! 'Tis the Brew's Weekly News Quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Fill in the blank: ____-____ trading uses complex algorithms to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/27/study-concludes-lightning-fast-trading-cost-investors-48-billion-annually?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">execute trades</a> in hyperspeed. A new study released this week estimates the practice costs investors $4.8 billion annually.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. One sans serif startup lost its <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/27/casper-loses-unicorn-status-ahead-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unicorn horn</a> this week ahead of its IPO, meaning it's now valued at less than $1 billion. <strong style="color:#000">Can you name it? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. On Wednesday, President Trump <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/president-trump-signs-usmca-nafta-replacement?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed into law</a> a revamped North American trade deal called USMCA. <strong style="color:#000">Name the 1994 trade deal it replaced.</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bonus to win a car: </strong></span><span><span>What does USMCA stand for?</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. WeWork is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/28/wework-phasing-free-alcohol-north-america?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phasing out</a> one of the following amenities at its North American office spaces. <strong style="color:#000">Which one?</strong></p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Do What You Love" posters</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Happy hours</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beer and wine taps</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Air conditioning </span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. Victoria’s Secret’s parent company is reportedly considering <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/l-brands-reportedly-weighing-sale-victorias-secret-wexner-talks-step?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">selling the brand</a> known for 5 for $25 deals and outdated beauty standards. What’s the parent company’s name?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers:</strong> 1. High-frequency 2. Casper 3. NAFTA; Bonus: U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement 4. Beer and wine taps 5. L Brands</em></sup></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/30/apple-launches-improved-maps-app.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a></span><span> deployed its new maps software.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/30/business/media/guardian-climate-change-fossil-fuel-advertisements.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Guardian</a></span><span> will no longer run ads from fossil fuel companies.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/30/tech/eu-apple-single-phone-chargers/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The European Parliament</a></span><span> is calling on tech companies to create a universal charger that works across devices and brands. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tea-giant-weighs-giving-up-on-tea-11580380902?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Unilever</a></span><span> is considering selling parts of its tea portfolio, including Lipton. Kermit is readying his bid.</span>
</li>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FRIDAY PUZZLE
</h3>
</td>
</tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today’s Friday Puzzle is going to be a challenge, but we think you’re up to it. Every year before the Super Bowl, we do a quiz on Roman numerals. This year’s challenge borrows from an <a href="https://j-archive.com/showgame.php?game_id=4499&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">epic <em>Jeopardy! </em>category</a> from 2014: “Initials to Roman Numerals to Numbers.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works: </strong>You’ll be given a clue that’ll lead to a person’s name. Those person’s initials will form a Roman numeral that can be translated into a regular number. The final answer is that number. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Example question: </strong></span><span>For the TV late-night host who in April 2014 announced he’d be retiring</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Answer: </strong></span><span>550. David Letterman = DL</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s go:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For the three-time Grammy nominated singer of “Havana”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For the naturalist who discussed his theory of evolution in </span><span><em>The Expression of the Emotions in Man and Animals </em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For the actor who had the title role in </span><span><em>The Bourne Ultimatum</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For the pilot who was Time’s first Man of the Year</span></li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGDP, which measures the total output of goods and services in the economy, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/08a2f1de2b72497eea5c63241afea73f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid None of the major themes have changed much—consumer spending was solid, but business investment continues to drop.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGEOPOLITICS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/30/britain-officially-leaves-eu?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nEveryone in the U.K. Tonight\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"SpongeBob's \"Ight Imma Head Out\" meme\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNDE3OTA1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSpongeBob\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn June 23, 2016, 52% of British voters chose to leave the EU, a sprawling governmental organization spanning 28 countries.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA lot has happened in the 1,317 days following the vote:\u003c/strong\u003e Prime ministers stepped down, proposed deals came and went, ceremonial maces \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/dec/10/day-of-brexit-drama-ends-with-mp-grabbing-the-ceremonial-mace?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere grabbed\u003c/a\u003e. But tonight, at 11pm London time (6pm ET), Brexit is actually, seriously, indubitably happening. The U.K. will leave the bloc and the EU will become a perfect cube.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's a historic moment that reflects the dissatisfaction many Europeans feel toward the ambitious political and economic experiment. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat lies ahead\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe've all done it:\u003c/strong\u003e the awkward double goodbye. Britain will enter a transition period in which...not much changes. The U.K. will remain part of the EU's tariff-free single market and customs union. \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/16/travel/brexit-travel-impact.html?action=click\u0026module=RelatedLinks\u0026pgtype=Article\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTravel\u003c/a\u003e shouldn't be affected. The U.K. will \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-51194363?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill contribute\u003c/a\u003e to the EU budget. And Liverpudlians will be free to go work in Milan and vice versa. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDuring this period, U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson will be zipping around the globe trying to score trade deals with the EU and other countries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt'll be a sprint. The transition ends at the end of 2020, and Johnson has ruled out any extension.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe EU's recent trade deals with Japan and Canada took seven years to massage, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/brexit-scotland-trade-eu.html?action=click\u0026module=RelatedLinks\u0026pgtype=Article\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe NYT notes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003e\"The U.K. is entering a decade of potentially profound structural change,\" Bank of England Governor Mark Carney \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-boe/sensing-a-pick-up-boe-keeps-rates-steady-as-carney-bows-out-idUSKBN1ZT1FN?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e at his final policy meeting yesterday. Even if Johnson gets those trade deals signed, lower immigration and business investment will stunt already limp economic growth. If he doesn't…expect supply chain chaos.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe \"not very important, but still fun\" section\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBritish passports will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-42443253?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eswitch\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from the EU's burgundy back to blue, a design that was introduced nearly 100 years ago. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eToday, the Royal Mint will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-51250753?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelease\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about 3 million commemorative 50p Brexit coins bearing the inscription \"Peace, prosperity and friendship with all nations.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIBM made the surprise \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/30/ibm-ceo-ginni-rometty-steps-down-arvind-krishna-to-take-over.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannouncement\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that CEO Ginni Rometty will step aside April 6. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking back \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Rometty \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2011/10/26/technology/ibm-names-a-new-chief.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eascended\u003c/a\u003e to the corner office in Jan. 2012, IBM was still shedding its image as a legacy hardware provider. Rometty refocused the company on cloud computing services and emerging technologies like AI, blockchain, and quantum computing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s been a bumpy ride for investors, who watched IBM stock decline 27% over the last eight years.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIBM has struggled to keep pace in the competitive cloud market as Amazon and Microsoft surged ahead.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDon’t forget the trailblazing.\u003c/strong\u003e Rometty was IBM’s first female CEO and one of just a handful of female Fortune 500 CEOs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTaking over from Rometty is cloud and cognitive software boss Arvind Krishna, a key architect of IBM’s 2019 acquisition of Red Hat—a $34 billion play for what's known as the \"hybrid cloud\" market. Red Hat’s CEO Jim Whitehurst will become IBM's president. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIBM stock was up as much as 5% after hours following
